alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 01 at 10:09PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Colorado, including the following county, Larimer, and specifically the western end of the Cameron Peak burn scar. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1006 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain had moved out of the area. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. This will cause small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chambers Lake. - This includes the following additional locations... Long Draw Road.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
